tr.td: In a typical week, how many times do you talk on the phone with family, friends, or neighbors?
How often do you get together with friends or relatives?
How often do you attend church or religious services?
Do you belong to any clubs or organizations such as church groups, unions, fraternal or athletic groups, or school groups?
How often do you attend meetings of the clubs or organizations you belong to?
Are you married, widowed, divorced, separated, never married, or living with a partner?
Q1: How often do you have a drink containing alcohol?
Q2: How many drinks containing alcohol do you have on a typical day when you are drinking?
Q3: How often do you have six or more drinks on one occasion?
How hard is it for you to pay for the very basics like food, housing, medical care, and heating?
Do you feel stress - tense, restless, nervous, or anxious, or unable to sleep at night because your mind is troubled all the time - these days?
On average, how many days per week do you engage in moderate to strenuous exercise (like a brisk walk)?
On average, how many minutes do you engage in exercise at this level?
Within the past 12 months, you worried that your food would run out before you got the money to buy more.
Within the past 12 months, the food you bought just didn't last and you didn't have money to get more.
In the past 12 months, has lack of transportation kept you from medical appointments or from getting medications?
In the past 12 months, has lack of transportation kept you from meetings, work, or from getting things needed for daily living?
In the last 12 months, was there a time when you were not able to pay the mortgage or rent on time?

content.content:
Formatting of this note might be different from the original.
February 13, 2025, 13:26
Patient presented for access dermatology appointment. Patient assessed by RN. Allergies reviewed at this time. Medications reviewed with patient, medication reconciliation completed. PHQ2 completed. Patient escorted to waiting area to be assessed by provider.
February 13, 2025, 13:41
Discharged by provider.
Electronically signed by Lemna, Heather, RN at 02/14/2025 10:34 AM CST

Formatting of this note might be different from the original.
ACCESS Dermatology New Patient Clinic Note
CC:
Skin lesions
HPI: Falicia Thomas Jahnke is a 52 year old female with a history of well controlled HIV seen today for skin lesions.
For the past few years, she has noticed peeling on the upper part of the nose. Unclear if it is related to anything in particular. It happens once a year, this time it happened earlier this month and is now improving. She applies vaseline which helps.
She also asks about a lesion on the back. She picks at it as it itchy. She uses Blue Start ointment.
No other skin complaints.
REVIEW OF SYSTEMS:
Gen: No fever, no chills, no unintended weight loss
Derm: as above
PHYSICAL EXAM/ASSESSMENT/PLAN:
Exam Areas: A limited exam of the face and lower back was performed today.
Pertinent findings include:
# Erosion: superficial erosion with ovelrying heme crust on the right nasal bridge
-As this is in a late stage of healing, unable to clearly say what caused this.
-Vaseline BID
-Send photo if new lesion occurs
# Prurigo nodularis: pruritic, firm, excoriated, dome-shaped nodules on the mid lower back
-Start clobetasol ointment BID x 2 weeks then take 2 week break then may repeat.
Return to clinic in 2 months or sooner prn.
The treatment plan was discussed with the patient, who voiced understanding, and all questions were answered.
Cristina Thomas, MD
Assistant Professor
UT Southwestern Department of Dermatology
UT Southwestern Department of Internal Medicine
Electronically signed by Thomas, Cristina, MD at 02/14/2025 10:34 AM CST
